name: CSE555 Final Project - Automatic Image Colorization
body:
### **Abstract**
This project focus on automatic image colorization given a greyscale input image. Different from [Levin et al.'s](http://www.cs.huji.ac.il/%7Eyweiss/Colorization/) approach, and [Image Analogies](http://mrl.nyu.edu/projects/image-analogies/) which rely on user interaction, this project implement a fully automatic colorization method proposed in [Large-scale Learning](http://vision.cs.illinois.edu/projects/lscolor/largescale_automatic_colorization.pdf) which exploits a LEARCH framework to train a quadratic objective function in the chromaticity maps and then colorize the image by minimize this objective function.

***
### **Best result**

***
### **Problem definition**
What are the specific inputs and outputs of your program.

***
### **Related Work**
Does your code replicate an existing paper? What is that paper? If not an exact replica, what are the closest works?

***
### **Algorithm**
Did you exactly replicate a prior work? Almost? What differences do you have? You may use code that implements the main idea of your project, but then you must have a project that explores modifications to the basic code, a substantially different dataset or for a different purpose than the original authors intended.

***
### **Analysis** 
Now that you have used this approach, what do you think are its main strengths and weaknesses.
